item.title: Nourishing and easy sweet potato and lentil bowls - ABC News
item.description: This jazzy little bowl is made from simple ingredients. The sweet potato is roasted gently with spices and tinned lentils are roasted until crisp.

item.title: Rare good news for critically endangered east coast grey nurse sharks
item.description: Scientists say increasing numbers of east coast grey nurse sharks is rare good conservation news for the critically endangered species.

item.title: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital cancels children in war discussion citing staff safety
item.description: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital says a symposium on the effect of war on children has been cancelled due to safety fears, but some doctors say pressure from a group opposing antisemitism is to blame.

item.title: Bush band tells Aboriginal people's side of the Maralinga nuclear weapon tests story
item.description: For Liam Tunkin, making music is about continuing his late father's legacy and sharing a dark part of Australia's history.

item.title: Wallabies fall to 28-26 defeat against Argentina in The Rugby Championship in Sydney
item.description: The Wallabies have fallen just short of a magical comeback against Argentina, losing 28-26 in a thrilling Rugby Championship Test in Sydney.

item.title: Erika Kirk makes first public statement after assassination of husband Charlie Kirk
item.description: Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika, delivers her first public remarks since the fatal shooting of her influencer husband.

item.title: Advocates call for action on brain health as AIHW reveals dementia is leading cause of death
item.description: Advocates warn the number of people with the condition could exceed 1 million without government intervention.

item.title: Penrith Panthers, Cronulla Sharks win NRL elimination finals against Warriors, Sydney Roosters
item.description: The Sharks are looking to correct the mistakes of the past, as they advance to the semifinals with a 20-10 victory over the Roosters.

item.title: Supreme Court gives Queensland hospital permission to terminate 12yo girl's pregnancy
item.description: A 12-year-old girl in residential care in Queensland should be allowed to have an abortion, a court rules, after a judge found she was not capable of making the decision herself.

item.title: NRLW wrap: Brisbane Broncos thrash the Cowboys 50-4, Gold Coast grab last finals spot
item.description: It's a big day for Queensland sides in the NRLW, as the Broncos — led by skipper Tamika Upton — are far too good for the third-placed Cowboys, while the Titans clinch the last finals spot with a win over Canberra.

item.title: WA Health issues measles warning as two more cases linked to Bali travel
item.description: West Australians planning to visit South-East Asia are being urged to get vaccinated against measles, with two more cases linked with travel to Bali.

item.title: Labor win Kiama by-election as voters replace disgraced MP Gareth Ward
item.description: The NSW Premier said Kiama now has the ear of the government after it claimed victory in the by-election triggered by the resignation of convicted rapist Gareth Ward.

item.title: Brisbane far too good for Gold Coast in QClash semifinal, setting up Collingwood prelim date
item.description: Bouncing back from a resounding loss to Geelong, the Brisbane Lions comfortably dispense of the Gold Coast Suns to advance to the preliminary finals.

item.title: Torrie Lewis makes semifinals at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo, Day 1
item.description: Torrie Lewis broke the national record to claim a spot in the women's 100m semifinal, as Lauren Ryan recorded Australia's best finish in a 10,000m final since 2003 on day one of the World Athletics Championships.

item.title: From Formula 1 to creating the 'world's best' croissant, how baking saved Lune founder Kate Reid's life
item.description: Kate Reid's Lune croissants have been called the world's best. But how did a young woman struggling with a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

item.title: Children missing out on early intervention for language delays due to shortage of speech pathologists
item.description: One in four children starting school now has a speech or language delay. It can hold back their learning, affect their friendships and harm their mental health. Speech therapists are struggling to find ways to support them all, but one school is leading the way.

item.title: Trump hits out at Florida's 'tough stance' on vaccines
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Donald Trump's health chief, RFK Jr, is dividing Republicans on vaccines
item.description: US Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr's anti-vaccination agenda is gaining ground, but resistance is coming from all sides.

item.title: 'Bone lady' who helped find Daniel Morcombe still unearthing stories of the dead
item.description: From the search for Daniel Morcombe to a flaming roadside torso, Queensland's top forensics cop deals with some of the state's worst crimes — when she's not identifying fallen Australians on WWI battlefields.

item.title: Aboriginal artist Emily Kam Kngwarray becomes first Australian with solo exhibition at London's Tate Modern
item.description: Emily Kam Kngwarray has been recognised as "one of the world's leading artists" after becoming the first Australian whose work is the subject of a solo exhibition at the Tate Modern Gallery in London.

item.title: Wallaroos' Rugby World Cup hopes dashed by dominant Canada in 46-5 loss
item.description: The Wallaroos miss the chance to reach the Rugby World Cup semifinals, losing heavily 46-5 to Canada in Bristol.

item.title: The Pacific won a stunning climate victory at the International Court of Justice. What's next?
item.description: Pacific Island nations are weighing up how to use a historic international court ruling in their fight to bring about stronger emissions reductions and climate justice.

item.title: World-famous bee sanctuary on Kangaroo Island under threat from Varroa mite
item.description: Beekeepers on Kangaroo Island are demanding that biosecurity measures be boosted to prevent a deadly parasite from wiping out the island's world-famous bee sanctuary.

item.title: 'White-hot anger' in the bush as Victorians fight government on multiple fronts
item.description: Rural residents and local councils are deeply unhappy with new taxes, renewable energy, bad roads and mining companies, accusing the state government of "city centric" policymaking.

item.title: Carlton AFLW side has reached a 'turning point' after challenging years
item.description: Inaugural Carlton player Gab Pound says the club has reached a turning point after not making the finals since the 2020 COVID-interrupted season.

item.title: Brick-pit frog recovery another win for green and gold at Sydney Olympics site
item.description: Twenty-five years after the Sydney Olympics, an important Homebush planning decision has led to successful conservation efforts for a species born in the green and gold. But a deadly fungus poses a threat.

item.title: 'Where to now?' Liberals soul searching after heavy loss in Kiama by-election
item.description: For a party that had just suffered a heavy defeat, the mood at the Liberals' post-election event was surprisingly upbeat on Saturday night.

item.title: Steeplechaser Tim Van de Velde stops to help struggling rival at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Belgium's Tim Van de Velde provides the highlight of the opening night of the World Athletics Championships, helping a fellow competitor cross the finish line.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The Franklin River rescue was extreme. Here's how medics prepare for the wilderness
item.description: The Franklin River rescue was an extreme test for the skills of medics. In remote Tasmania, here's how they train for "chaos".

item.title: Outback nurse transforms remote diabetes care with cans, rocks and bush tucker
item.description: When Rishoniy Caine arrived in a remote NSW community with one general store and no gym, she knew fixing its diabetes problem would need a different approach to what had already failed the locals.

item.title: The federal press gallery is ceding power to the Albanese government
item.description: The federal press gallery is ceding power to the Albanese government. It needs to take it back.

item.title: How to watch the 2025 Primetime Emmys in Australia
item.description: Your pocket guide to watching the Emmy awards in Australia.

item.title: Victorian farmers welcome spring forecast despite long-term climate concerns
item.description: As spring brings a flicker of hope, some farmers cautiously embrace optimism while others face mounting pressures and climate uncertainty.

item.title: Residents in flood-affected communities want more warning technology
item.description: For generations, farmers and outback communities have relied on the bush telegraph during floods but it has fallen silent in recent years, leaving residents without up-to-date information.

item.title: All Blacks forced to re-group after 43-10 loss to Springboks in Rugby Championship
item.description: After a demoralising 43-10 loss to the Springboks on home soil, the All Blacks are looking to rebound against the Wallabies in the upcoming Bledisloe Cup Tests.

item.title: Creamed honey nostalgia helps producers find niche market
item.description: Some New South Wales beekeepers are determined to stay the course in the face of varroa mite, turning to childhood memories for inspiration.

item.title: Victoria set to have first new national parks in more than a decade
item.description: Conservation groups are celebrating proposed legislation for three new national parks in Victoria but not all bush users are happy.

item.title: Platypuses found dead in illegal fishing traps in regional Victoria
item.description: Anglers are urged to dispose of illegal fishing nets and stick with safer open-top traps, after two platypuses are found drowned in regional Victorian waterways.

item.title: 'World's biggest' hockey game in York fundraises for cancer research
item.description: More than 370 people participate in a hockey game lasting more than eight hours in honour of a little girl who died from a rare form of cancer earlier this year.

item.title: Sussan Ley reshuffles frontbench in wake of Jacinta Nampijinpa Price saga
item.description: West Australian MP Melissa Price will replace Jacinta Nampijinpa Price as the shadow minister for defence industry and personnel, after the outspoken senator was sacked for refusing to back her leader.

item.title: How to give your indoor plants a spring clean
item.description: As gardens, parks and nature strips start showing signs of spring, our indoor plants might need a little help to jump into the new season.

item.title: Lachie Neale gives himself '50 per cent' chance of improbable grand final appearance after calf injury
item.description: Lachie Neale admits medical professionals are not holding out much hope of him recovering from a calf injury in time for the grand final, but he is not giving up.

item.title: Ben Hunt's Golden Point field goal sends Brisbane Broncos into NRL prelims after downing Canberra Raiders in all-time classic
item.description: Jamal Fogarty scores a try in Golden Point to send the Raiders to a preliminary final only for it to be disallowed before Ben Hunt delivers a dagger field goal.

item.title: FBI director Kash Patel to face congressional hearing amid missteps on Charlie Kirk assassination
item.description: Kash Patel faces a clear test of whether he can convince the country that the FBI, under his watch, can avoid compounding its mistakes in a time of political violence and deepening distrust.

item.title: Jess Hull cruises to 1,500m final at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo
item.description: Jess Hull made light work of a rough semifinal to progress in the women's 1,500, but Linden Hall and Torrie Lewis both fell just short of making the final themselves.

item.title: AFLW Round 5 Sunday wrap: Kangaroos claim grand final rematch against Lions as Saints and Cats record big wins
item.description: North Melbourne continues its blistering start to the AFLW season as Geelong and St Kilda also record big wins in Round 5.

item.title: Belgians break Australian hearts in Davis Cup classic
item.description: Beligum's Raphael Collignon wore down late stand-in Aleksandar Vukic in the deciding rubber to lead Belgium to the quarter-finals.

item.description: Brisbane and Canberra went to the great beyond in their golden point finals match and it was Reece Walsh who led the Broncos to the promised land.

item.title: Liberal Party immigration fight is a battle over how the party wants to position itself
item.description: Immigration has become a new fault line inside the Liberal Party that will erupt again.

item.title: The higher Australia's 2035 emissions target, the more necessary a carbon tax will be
item.description: Australia's emissions reduction number is, in short, a laugh-or-cry-o-meter, or perhaps more accurately, a tax-o-meter.

item.title: GIM Trading accused of defrauding millions from ordinary Australian investors with 'low risk' bonds
item.description: A Gold Coast musician approached by a man he knew from a local bar went on to front a trading company, later accused of defrauding millions from ordinary Australian investors.

item.title: Dads leaving sex education to mums, report finds, with concerns young boys are missing out
item.description: New report finds mothers do more of the sex education at home, raising concerns that young boys are missing out on key information from their dads.

item.title: Family violence survivors waiting years for social housing as demand surges in Victoria
item.description: As family violence survivor and mother-of-two, Maya was assessed as a high priority for social housing. Eight years later, she's finally moved into a suitable home in outer-suburban Melbourne, with vulnerable Victorians left waiting for years as the social housing waitlist soars.

item.title: Weather to warm up in Queensland, as more rain forecast for the north
item.description: The southern half of Queensland can expect fine weather at least for the first half of the week, while more rain is on the way for the north of the state.

item.title: Antarctic expeditioners join research project to help astronauts on space missions
item.description: Expeditioners at Australia's Antarctic stations are taking part in a research project to better understand the cognitive and physiological impacts of extended deployments — which can include actual "brain shrinkage".

item.title: SA government error in your favour — collect $1 million
item.description: Political parties usually get in trouble for breaking their election promises. But what happens when they keep a promise that never actually existed?

item.title: Residents say former Moe Hospital could become public housing
item.description: A retired nurse who worked at Moe Hospital says the closed facility could be used for housing rather than left to further rot.

item.description: Matildas star Sam Kerr scores her 100th goal for Chelsea just minutes after returning to the pitch for the Blues for her first game since 2023.

item.title: Nepalese migrants in Australia turning to parents to help with childcare and culture
item.description: For many Nepalese families living in Canberra, the arrival of parents from overseas is both a helping hand with raising children and a connection to their homeland.

item.description: A report obtained by lobby group Lock The Gate under right-to-information laws reveal a mine in central Queensland was releasing sediment into environmentally sensitive areas for more than a decade.

item.description: After a tough start to the year, Geelong sit just outside the top eight and equal on points with the reining grand finalists.

item.title: ANZ hit with a record $240m fine for 'unconscionable' conduct, ASX claws back early losses — as it happened
item.description: ANZ has been hit with a massive fine for unconscionable conduct impacting 65,000 customers, ranging from the federal government to dead account holders.

item.description: Environment Minister Murray Watt approved the extension of Australia's biggest gas project last week.

item.title: Specialist GPs to diagnose ADHD in WA amid calls for further easing of restrictions
item.description: As a select cohort of WA GPs begins to diagnose ADHD in people older than 10, parents of younger children and some medical professionals have expressed concerns about the scheme.

item.description: Superstar Broncos fullback Reece Walsh will be free to play in the NRL preliminary finals after avoiding suspension for a headbutt on Hudson Young in Brisbane's epic win on Sunday.

item.description: Producers in Western Australia's premier wine region say the state government's expanded bottle recycling scheme is set to cost them millions of dollars.

item.description: Australia's Cricket World Cup preparations are in full swing as three batters score half-centuries in a big run chase in the first of three ODIs against India.

item.description: The Pitt wins Best Drama at the 77th Annual Primetime Emmy Awards, with The Studio, Adolescence and even Stephen Colbert walking away as the biggest winners of the night.

item.description: Mud and silt continue to choke the channel connecting the controversial development to the Great Barrier Reef, once again putting industry and conservationists at odds over the fix.

item.description: Fred Brophy will sell you a ticket, spin you a yarn and dare you into the ring, but at 73, the outback ringmaster is slowing down.

item.description: One and a half million Australians are at risk from sea levels rising by 2050 unless climate change can be limited, Australia’s first national climate risk assessment warns.

item.description: Max Basheer — the football administrator who oversaw the creation of the Adelaide Crows and the purpose-built stadium Football Park — has died aged 98.

item.title: AFL State of Origin will return, with Western Australia-Victoria clash confirmed
item.description: AFL chief executive Andrew Dillon confirms Western Australia will play Victoria in Perth next February in the first State of Origin match since 1999.

item.title: Prince Harry says he has no regrets about 2023 memoir Spare
item.description: Prince Harry has defended his tell-all autobiography Spare, insisting he has no regrets about its publication.

item.description: A 39-year-old man has been charged with giving a Nazi salute at the AFL semifinal in Brisbane on Saturday night.

item.title: Indian cricketers refuse to shake hands with Pakistani counterparts at Asia Cup
item.description: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav refuses to shake hands after his side's seven-wicket win over Pakistan at the Asia Cup in the latest controversial episode between the two rivals.

item.description: Tarryn Aiken will miss the Sydney Roosters' NRLW finals campaign, with scans confirming a knee injury that will require a knee reconstruction.

item.title: Alphonce Felix Simbu wins marathon gold at World Athletics Championships
item.description: After running for more than two hours, the winner of the men's marathon at the World Athletics Championships was decided by less than a second.

item.title: Inquest hears prison system failed Aboriginal inmate before he died
item.description: A coronial inquest hears the system failed First Nations prisoner Clinton Austin before his death.

item.title: Emmys 2025 winners: Adolescence, Severance, The Pitt and The Studio win big
item.description: The 77th Primetime Emmy Awards are honouring the best and brightest in the US television industry. Here are the shows that picked up the trophies.

item.title: Teenager charged as police search continues after Moree motel stabbing
item.description: A 13-year-old boy has been been granted bail as police search for four others suspected of being involved in the stabbing of a 52-year-old man in Moree.

item.title: Starving wallabies at The Briars spark urgent Mornington Peninsula Shire council meeting
item.description: A study prompted by the deaths of wallabies at a beloved wildlife reserve south of Melbourne finds the population has grown five times larger than what The Briars sanctuary can sustain.

item.title: SA to roll out ChatGPT-style AI app in all high schools as tech experts urge caution
item.description: A ChatGPT-style app to be rolled out at all South Australian high schools next term has been welcomed by tech experts, who are also warning its use should be carefully managed.

item.description: From a rallying political cry from Hacks star Hannah Einbinder to standing ovations for Stephen Colbert, here are your Emmys 2025 key moments.

item.title: How much fish is in tinned tuna, and how to shop for your needs
item.description: When you're at the supermarket, do you wonder how much much tuna you're getting in a can? A series of popular social media has been comparing how much food there is in some packaged items.

item.title: How is Australia affected by climate change? The National Climate Risk Assessment models the future
item.description: For the first time, the government has modelled the threats from climate change on Australia's future. What's the point of a document like this, and can it help us avoid the worst-case scenarios?

item.title: Hundreds of pigs feared dead in fire at Dublin's Andgar piggery
item.description: It has taken all day for a fire at a controversial piggery north of Adelaide to be put out. RSPCA inspectors are attending the piggery, which was already under investigation over cruelty claims.

item.title: Cricket Tasmania seeking ways to make proposed Macquarie Point stadium 'compatible' for matches
item.description: After initial concerns that the roof design of the proposed Hobart AFL stadium at Macquarie Point would hinder cricket matches, sporting authorities have thrown their support behind the build, saying "we will find a way".

item.title: Australia's richest person among hundreds of donors to NT senator's legal fund
item.description: Australia's richest person, Gina Rinehart, has helped fund Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's crowd-funded defence to a defamation action brought by the head of a Northern Territory land council.

item.title: Defence dilemma facing Anthony Albanese as he heads to New York
item.description: Amid uncertainty over whether the prime minister will secure his first one-on-one meeting with Donald Trump, the political test is whether his recent defence commitments will be seen as a genuine step-up on capability or a sidestep from American calls to spend more.

item.title: Inmate tells inquest guards referred to Indigenous man who died in custody with derogatory slurs
item.description: An inmate, who cannot be named, provided details of an Indigenous man's treatment in custody, as an inquest into the man's death continues.

item.title: Newcastle Knights announce Justin Holbrook as new NRL head coach
item.description: Sydney Roosters assistant coach Justin Holbrook has been named the new head coach of the Newcastle Knights.

item.title: Shadow minister Andrew Hastie says he will be 'without a job' if Liberals don't abandon net zero
item.description: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Hastie indicates he will quit or be dumped from the shadow cabinet if the Coalition does not abandon the target of achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.

item.description: Whispering Jack: The John Farnham Musical is one of 13 plays coming to Sydney Theatre Company next year, alongside shows starring David Wenham and Miranda Otto.

item.title: NRL announces preliminary finals dates, Melbourne Storm on Friday, Brisbane Broncos play Sunday
item.description: The NRL has shaken up its preliminary finals weekend, electing to host one of its grand final qualifiers on a Sunday for the first time in 18 years.

item.title: Armand Mondo Duplantis breaks world record, Kurtis Marschall wins pole vault bronze at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo
item.description: Kurtis Marschall wins bronze in the men's pole vault final on day three of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, as Armand Duplantis soars to a 14th world record.

item.title: All the latest financial news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Final rules for social media ban revealed, with no legally enforceable effectiveness standard
item.description: While substantial fines would apply to social media platforms that make no effort to ban under-16s, they would not need to test the age of every user.

item.title: US and China agree to TikTok 'framework' ownership agreement at trade talks in Spain
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the framework would see the platform switch to US ownership.

item.title: Former MMA fighter Conor McGregor drops out of Irish presidential race
item.description: Critics say the former MMA fighter's pre-emptive dropout was to save face in a likely knockout at the hands of Dublin City Council.

item.title: Australia-PNG defence treaty will require countries to 'act' if either one is attacked
item.description: Australia and Papua New Guinea will be legally obliged to defend each other from a military attack on either territory under a landmark defence treaty, the ABC can reveal.

item.description: Tyler Robinson, 22, was arrested last week over the death of conservative influencer Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Lawyers urge Australians to ensure valid will in place as house prices rise
item.description: Lawyers urge Australians to ensure they leave behind a valid will to avoid legal disputes as surging house prices and superannuation balances increase the size of inheritances.

item.title: Fewer Aussies would need NDIS if government boosted mental health support, expert says
item.description: As the Albanese government seeks to rein in the cost of the NDIS, a former Australian of the Year says money could be saved with this one shift.

item.title: Climate Risk Assessment's 'high risk' warning for 1 million Australian homes
item.description: One in 10 homes could be effectively uninsurable by 2050, while lost labour productivity to extreme weather could wipe $211 billion in household wealth, the Climate Risk Assessment warns, with tourism, trade, and property values forecasted to take a dive.

item.title: ANZ commits bank errors in its favour. Is there any other kind?
item.description: ASIC has lived by that aphorism in its decision to strike a settlement deal with ANZ over a raft of wrongdoing.

item.title: Use constitutional power to raise age of criminal responsibility nationwide, lawyers tell PM
item.description: Forty years ago, the federal government used the constitution to halt construction of the Franklin Dam. Now lawyers want the Albanese government to do the same to keep kids out of jails.

item.title: How Melbourne mosquitoes are being used to fight dengue fever and save lives in Laos
item.description: They are the deadliest animals in the world, and millions of them are being sent from Australia to the Laos capital Vientiane in a bid to save lives.

item.title: Pathological Demand Avoidance, a little-known profile of autism affecting kids and adults
item.description: A surge of professional and personal interest in Pathological Demand Avoidance (PDA), an autism subtype — which in children can affect everything from cleaning teeth to attending school — has led to Australia's first-ever PDA conference, to be held in Perth in November.

item.description: Australia's Jess Hull has self-belief, despite facing an uphill task to beat three-time world and Olympic champion Faith Kipyegon over 1,500m at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

item.title: WWII-era bombs are killing and injuring thousands in PNG. Now trainees will learn how to remove them
item.description: Trainees in Papua New Guinea will learn to remove unexploded ordnance, as fading memories of World War II expose more people to the conflict's dangerous legacy.

item.description: A "shocking" warning that heatwave deaths could skyrocket brings the issue of urban heat back into sharp focus, particularly in the city's west.

item.description: It's not the be all and end all — but the impending delivery of the Tasmanian Planning Commission's final report is a major moment for the Macquarie Point stadium.

item.description: A pollination ecologist says it is important people play their part in preserving native bees.

item.title: Lisa Cook and Stephen Miran set for US Federal Reserve meeting, ASX gains — as it happened
item.description: The ASX gained ground on Tuesday, while markets now have greater certainty about the make-up of the US Federal Reserve board for this week's key rates meeting. Look back on the day's events and insights on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.description: Tia-Clair Toomey-Orr has been considered the CrossFit GOAT for some time, and she is not slowing down.

item.description: Pro-Palestinian protests sparked by the inclusion of an Israeli team in La Vuelta a España prompt the cancellation of the last stage of the race, with Spain's prime minister calling for Israel to be treated like Russia by sporting organisations.

item.title: The hidden impact of injuries costing AFL clubs millions

item.title: Rex Airlines apologises after wheelchair-using passenger stranded for six hours at Perth Airport
item.description: Albany woman Debby Butler says she had to ask strangers to help her to the bathroom after Rex delayed her flight home from Perth Airport and left her without a wheelchair.

item.description: Conservationists had raised concerns about Vantara but investigators say the issues raised are "devoid of merit".

item.title: Lisa Reihana's exhibition, Voyager, recasts history through an Indigenous lens
item.description: The internationally renowned Maori artist's technically complex, visually mesmerising exhibition spans nearly a decade of artwork.

item.title: How to determine if your kid is well enough for child care
item.description: Work demands and a lack of village mean keeping a child at home from care every time they have a sniffle can be a dilemma for many parents. So when it it OK to send them?

item.description: The long-time nightly newsreader says it was an "instant choice" to leave work as his daughter faced a battle with cancer.

item.title: Sydney Olympics inflatable art reappears after 25 years in rural NSW
item.description: A Coonabarabran artist made a lucky find at an online auction two years ago when she recognised a Reg Mombassa art piece from the Sydney Olympics mixed in with advertising devices.

item.title: Craig McLachlan withdraws from Cluedo stage show following backlash
item.description: Less than a week ago, Craig McLachlan was announced to play Colonel Mustard in the forthcoming national tour, making his return to the theatre after The Rocky Horror Show.

item.title: Planning commission rejects bid to turn Redbank Power Station into bioenergy hub
item.description: The Independent Planning Commission of NSW knocks back plans to restart Redbank Power Station in the Hunter Valley, fuelling it with biomass instead of coal tailings.

item.title: Australia Diamonds announce netball squads for Test series against New Zealand, South Africa
item.description: Goal-shooter Lucy Austin is a shock selection in the Australian netball squad to face South Africa, winning a place after initially being included as an "invitee" to their training camp.

item.title: Central Queensland included in fire ant biosecurity zones
item.description: New restrictions in place on moving materials into five central Queensland sites to reduce the spread of the invasive species.

item.title: Where and how to watch the 2025 Primetime Emmy award-wining shows in Australia
item.description: From The Studio to The Pitt, here's how to stream the biggest winners of the 2025 Primetime Emmy Awards.

item.title: Victoria delays Gippsland offshore wind auction, stalling developers
item.description: The Victorian government pushes back its timeline for new offshore wind farms in the state's east in a blow to developers looking to move their projects to the next stage.

item.title: Aaron Chen talks comedy, faith, and moving to New York
item.description: How Aaron Chen went from being booted out of Sydney pubs to winning Logies and chasing global stardom.

item.title: Papua New Guinea celebrates journey to independence, 50 years after parting with Australia
item.description: On the foreshore of Papua New Guinea's capital city, Ela Beach is where locals come to exercise, mingle and unwind at the end of a long day. But it wasn't always this way.

item.title: Does washing your fruit and veggies remove chemicals?
item.description: This is what experts have to say about washing fruit and veggies, with removing chemicals and reducing the amount we consume in mind.

item.title: Donald Trump files defamation and libel lawsuit against The New York Times, claiming 'massive economic damage to his brand value'
item.description: In a lengthy post on his social media platform, the US president accused The New York Times of lying about him, his family and his business.

item.title: Concurrent disasters will overwhelm responders, stress ADF, risk report warns
item.description: A dedicated disaster recovery force is needed, or else responders and defence forces could be "overwhelmed" by multiple concurrent natural disasters, the National Climate Risk Assessment warns.

item.title: Breastfeeding Gold Coast mum says she was asked to leave Virgin Australia lounge
item.description: Mother-of-two Elise Turner says she was asked to leave the Virgin Australia business lounge after refusing to go to a bathroom to pump breast milk.

item.title: How Isabelle Kelly shook off getting her 'teeth pushed back' to return for Roosters' NRLW finals charge
item.description: Isabelle Kelly was meant to rest up for a few weeks after suffering an oral fracture that nearly cost her several teeth but the Roosters skipper missed just one match and has now returned to lead the club's premiership charge.

item.title: China has a 'chokehold' on the rare earth supply chain. Could Australia offer an alternative?
item.description: Rare earths are critical for manufacturing everything from electric vehicles to wind turbines and defence equipment, and with China's dominance over the supply chain, they have also become inextricably enmeshed in geopolitics.

item.title: Hundreds of pigs die as Andgar Proprietors piggery catches fire with two sheds burning for over 12 hours
item.description: The Department of Primary Industries and Regions says about 200 animals died in the blaze while another 45 pigs were euthanised by the department and RSPCA.

item.title: Israeli military launches ground offensive to occupy Gaza City
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces says its expanded operation in Gaza City "to destroy Hamas's military infrastructure" has begun, with residents warned to move south.

item.title: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, major United Nations report finds
item.description: Israel has committed and is continuing to commit genocide in Gaza, according to the "most authoritative assessment" to date.

item.title: James O'Connor still hopeful of playing Bledisloe Cup for Wallabies against All Blacks
item.description: James O'Connor has flown to England with his Test future still up in the air, but the Wallabies playmaker has not given up on playing in his first Bledisloe Cup match in five years.

item.title: A UN report says Israel is committing genocide. Experts hope it spurs Australia to act
item.description: What ultimately determines whether the UN's report joins the list of other shocking but overlooked inquiries is whether this latest finding moves any governments, including Australia's, to take further action.

item.title: Approval of $453 million battery project angers Kiewa Valley residents
item.description: The state government approves the development of a $453 million energy storage system by a Chinese company in the state's north-east, angering nearby residents who say their concerns have been ignored.

item.title: Jacinta Allan's trip to China aims to court investment and voters back home
item.description: Jacinta Allan's one week trip to the Middle Kingdom is a show with two audiences, as she eyes Chinese investment and hopes to solidify her party's relationship with Chinese Victorians.

item.title: China accuses Philippines of 'illegal' intrusion at its new nature reserve
item.description: China's coastguard has accused Philippine ships of illegally entering China's territorial waters at a shoal that is internationally recognised as within the Philippines' exclusive economic zone.

item.title: NRL finals week two team lists: Canterbury Bulldogs pick new halves combination
item.description: Winger Jacob Kiraz has revealed he is happy to keep playing with painkilling injections as a patched-up Canterbury turn to a barely tested halves combination of Lachlan Galvin and Toby Sexton to save their NRL season.

item.title: Man 'choked to death' on ribbons and food in Adelaide nursing home, inquest told
item.description: A nursing home resident known to wander and ingest foreign objects died after choking on ribbons at a facility in Adelaide’s north, an inquest has heard.

item.title: Jess Hull wins 1,500m bronze, Peter Bol crashes out at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo
item.description: Jess Hull claims bronze in the women's 1,500m at the World Athletics Championships, after Peter Bol was eliminated from the 800m in the heats.

item.title: Is the Opposition in crisis over climate change policy?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Loosening China’s grip on the rare earths and minerals market
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Celebrating PNG’s 50th anniversary of independence
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Broadcaster Alan Jones hit with nine new indecent assault charges
item.description: Court records confirm the new charges were formally laid against veteran broadcaster Alan Jones on Monday.

item.title: Top stories from ABC News
item.description: Listen to ABC News interviews and commentary and analysis from radio programs like AM, PM and The World Today.

item.title: Robert Redford, Hollywood idol of the 1970s and Oscar-winning director and actor, has died aged 89
item.description: Redford died "at his home in Sundance in the mountains of Utah" surrounded by family, his publicist announced.

item.title: Nepal's protests estimated to have caused hundreds of millions of dollars in damage as families farewell those killed
item.description: As clean-up efforts continue and an interim government finds its feet, families have said farewell to loved ones killed in last week's violence.

item.title: Donald Trump takes aim at ABC journalist as he suggests he'll meet Albanese 'very soon'
item.description: Donald Trump takes aim at the ABC's Americas Editor during an extraordinary exchange at the White House, as the president suggests he will meet Prime Minister Anthony Albanese "very soon".

item.title: New York judge dismisses state terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione
item.description: The 27-year-old Ivy League graduate still faces New York state second-degree murder charges and a federal death penalty prosecution.

item.title: Timor-Leste protesters vow to continue rallying until plan to buy MPs 65 cars is overturned
item.description: The protests nearly doubled in size on Tuesday as people continued to vent their frustrations at a plan to buy MPs 65 new SUVs.

item.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect Tyler Robinson charged with murder as prosecutors seek death penalty
item.description: Utah prosecutors say they will seek the death penalty for the 22-year-old alleged shooter.

item.title: Australians too dependent on government, says Sussan Ley
item.description: In her first major economic speech, the opposition leader hits out at universal subsidies and says "dependency" has affected Australia's "national character".

item.title: Britain is hoping it has a secret weapon to charm Donald Trump this week: 'all his favourite things'
item.description: The US president has been given something no other world leader has ever received: a second state visit invitation from Buckingham Palace. But assessing the trip's success means looking beneath the pomp and pageantry.

item.title: Botox, fillers among the cosmetic injectables targeted in medical regulator's new rules
item.description: New rules have come into place aimed at better protecting patients from unsafe cosmetic procedures. Here's what it mean for your next appointment.

item.title: Threat of stagflation bears down on world's largest economy as Federal Reserve decision looms
item.description: The world's largest central bank is less than 24 hours from announcing one of the most anticipated interest rate decisions of the year.

item.title: What time does Gout Gout run at the World Athletics Championships? How to watch Gout Gout's 200m heat
item.description: Gout Gout will make his senior World Athletics Championships debut at the Tokyo National Stadium on Wednesday night. Here's how to watch.

item.title: Hundreds of childcare workers blacklisted but parents kept in the dark
item.description: About 400 educators were issued prohibition orders banning them from early education or care in the past five years, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: A plan to simplify Melbourne's bus network went to government, so why hasn't it happened?
item.description: Victoria is spending the least per capita on its urban bus system of any state, leaving some Melbourne residents in the lurch at their local bus stop.

item.title: Donald Trump chastised ABC journalist John Lyons over questions about his business dealings.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The Federal Home Guarantee Scheme is expanding, but just how many will be able to afford to buy in?
item.description: The expansion of the scheme, which allows first home buyers to purchase a property with as little as a 5 per cent deposit, has some warning it will also inflate the market. Here's what you'll need to be earning to get a foot in the door.

item.title: Unpaid mandatory work experience a 'significant barrier' for some NSW law students
item.description: During her unpaid placement at a not-for-profit community legal centre in Sydney, Dani struggled to make ends meet. She is among some law students whose entry into the profession is fraught with financial difficulty.

item.title: Fingal Post Office saved from closure after local farmers confirmed as new operators
item.description: A rural Tasmanian community has fought to keep its post office open, fearing losing the important service could lead to their hometown disappearing.

item.title: Israeli military vision appears to show vehicle movement through Gaza City
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Israeli military vehicles among damaged buildings near Gaza City.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: SA's ongoing harmful algal bloom labelled 'cultural emergency' by First Nations groups
item.description: First Nations South Australians say the harmful algal bloom impacting the state's coastline is a cultural emergency, as it continues to devastate beaches.

item.title: Fire threatens koala habitat at Gold Coast's Burleigh Headland national park
item.description: Police are investigating how a suspicious fire started in the popular tourist spot overnight, burning through around 75 per cent of the grass under the boulder clusters.

item.title: Palestinians fear they have no place to flee as Israel's army pushes deeper into Gaza city
item.description: Israeli troops encircle Gaza City as the UN chief slams the offensive as "systematic destruction", with thousands of Palestinians unable or unwilling to flee.

item.title: For the Adelaide Crows, the AFL season was a matter of 'what could have been'
item.description: After an eight-year AFL finals drought, the Adelaide Crows finished this year's home-and-away season as minor premiers — but the club's hopes were dashed by consecutive defeats that left the players and their fans wondering about what might have been.

item.title: Children are being 'poisoned' by high lead levels as state government agency is accused of report cover-up
item.description: A state government body sat on a report into lead dust that was "poisoning" children for nearly four years and tried to keep its release quiet.

item.title: Griffith locals push for new health district to meet needs of their community
item.description: Residents and medical professionals in south-western NSW are pushing to establish a new local health district in Griffith, arguing current services are not good enough.

item.title: ABC reporter reflects on heated exchange with Donald Trump
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Cashrewards's abrupt closure leaves shoppers many unanswered questions. Here's what we know
item.description: Two and a half million Australians have signed up for this cashback app, which leaves them wondering what's next.

item.title: Federal politics live: Donald Trumps flags meeting with Anthony Albanese
item.description: A long-awaited meeting between Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump could take place next week, the US president has suggested. Follow live.

item.title: New doco Signorinella: Little Miss celebrates the Italian women who shaped modern Australia
item.description: Signorinella: Little Miss, the new documentary from the filmmakers behind Lygon St — Si Parla Italiano, celebrates the tenacity of Italian Australian women in business and beyond.

item.title: NT DPP considering appeal of 'callous' fatal hit-run driver's home detention
item.description: The Northern Territory's Director of Public Prosecutions is considering whether to appeal a decision to allow a young fatal hit-and-run driver who bragged to his friends afterwards to avoid jail time.

item.title: Starving wallabies on the Mornington Peninsula have been spared from euthanasia after council motion
item.description: A council on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula has voted to relocate starving wallabies from The Briars wildlife sanctuary, rather than destroy them.

item.title: Sam Konstas scores Australia A century in four-day game in India
item.description: Sam Konstas's push for an Ashes spot continues as he clatters a century in an extended session for Australia A in Lucknow.

item.title: WA Police officers subject to restraining orders desk-bound under gun reforms, union says
item.description: WA Police officers are being taken off the beat because new firearms laws mean they can't carry a gun if they're subject to a restraining order, their union says.

item.title: Animal advocates want WA to 'get on board' with phasing out greyhound racing amid welfare concerns
item.description: Animal advocates call on the WA government to follow the lead of other jurisdictions and phase out greyhound racing, as a state parliamentary inquiry examines the sport.

item.title: Jess Hull completes second act at World Athletics Championships as quest for gold continues
item.description: Jess Hull claimed Australia's best result in a 1,500m at the world championships with a bronze medal, but she wants to make it gold next time around.

item.title: Markets live: ASX to fall, Wall Street slips from record highs ahead of Fed rate cut
item.description: The Australian share market is likely to fall in morning trade ahead of the latest ABS inflation data, while the Nasdaq rises above 17,000 points for the first time. Follow live.

item.title: Investigation underway after man dies following stabbing on Gwydir Highway near Grafton
item.description: A 35-year-old man has died after he was stabbed overnight in what police believe was a targeted attack on the Gwydir Highway in Grafton.
